meanings.definition: To fill with wonder or astonishment
meanings.sent1: The magic show will amaze the children.
meanings.sent2: The beautiful fireworks display never fails to amaze the crowd.
meanings.sent3: The talking dog managed to amaze everyone at the party.
meanings.sent4: The speed of the cheetah can amaze even the most seasoned wildlife experts.
meanings.sent5: The grandeur of the ancient palace will amaze visitors from around the world.

meanings.sent1: The complex riddle can amaze even the brightest minds.
meanings.sent2: The intricate maze of corridors can amaze visitors in the castle.
meanings.sent3: The sudden plot twist in the movie managed to amaze the audience.
meanings.sent4: The unexpected turn of events can amaze and confuse at the same time.
meanings.sent5: The cryptic message left behind by the spy will amaze the codebreakers.

meanings.definition: To cause someone to be greatly surprised
meanings.sent1: The surprise party will amaze your friend on their birthday.
meanings.sent2: The news of the discovery will amaze the scientific community.
meanings.sent3: The prank played by the students managed to amaze the teacher.
meanings.sent4: The unexpected win in the game can amaze even the underdog team.
meanings.sent5: The rare meteor shower will amaze stargazers with its beauty.
